Instructor: Hei Yuen White Pak 白曦源

E-mail: vincent\_pak@hotmail.com

**_English III: Literature and Culture_**

**_(For Lower-Intermediate Level or Above)_**

Fall, 2019

**Course Description:**

Is literature useless? This semester-length course aims to introduce students a wide range of contemporary literary works and, more importantly, highlight the usefulness of literature as it consolidates the foundation of one’s culture. The selected works will be studied aesthetically and critically in order to help students develop an in-depth view and analysis of literary works, heighten their sensibility of the social and cultural issues happening around the world, and hopefully provide them with different lenses to look at themselves.

**Textbook**

Readings prepared by the instructor

**Requirements and Rules**

1.  Class attendance, lesson preview, and active class participation are required. **Missing 4 classes** for any reason will result in an automatic F (0) for attendance and in-class participation, except specific occasions. Please send **an e-mail** to the instructor if you want to take leave.（以任何理由請假**4次（含）以上**，出席和課堂表現作0分論，除重大疾病或特殊情況外，請假請**寄電郵**給老師）
2.  Students are required to participate in group discussion and **take turns** to ask and answer questions raised by the instructor. Every response will be recorded.（積極參與討論、**輪流**提出及回答問題，每次提問或回答均須記錄）
3.  Every reading material is a must. Violation of this rule will **cost you 2 points** (out of your final score) each time.（忘記攜帶講義**一次扣總分2分**）
4.  Read the assigned readings beforehand. （**課前先閱讀文章**）
5.  Plagiarism or cheating on quizzes or exams is absolutely forbidden. If someone is found cheating on an exam, that student will get an automatic F (0) for the class.

**Grading Policies**

1.     Attendance and in-class participation                                     30%

2.     One oral presentation (PPT + peer evaluation)                       20%

3.     Final project (PPT + peer evaluation)                                     20%

4.     Take-home exam                                                                     20%

5.     In-class assignments (raising in-depth questions)                   10%                        

**Bonus Points**

1.  Spending time on Self-Access English Center \[樸101 &102\], English Chat Room, Writing Center and 2/F NTNU library (**at most 3 points**)
2.  Participate in activities that help improve your English ability, such as three-minute presentation competition, listening to English talks, language exchange (**at most 3 points**)
